org.hs.generator
Class GVariable

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.hs.generator.GConstruct
        |
        +--org.hs.generator.GVariable
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Comparable, org.hs.util.Copy, GExpression, GStatement, at.dms.compiler.PhylumListener, Serializable
public class GVariable
extends GConstruct
implements GExpression, GStatement, Comparable

This chameleonic class can represent a local variable, a class field, a parameter, or one of the keywords this, super, class, length. See the instance fields for rules regarding each intended use of GVariable.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

CLASS

public static final String CLASS
See Also:
Constant Field Values

modifiers

public int modifiers
The modifiers of the variable, as defined by java.lang.reflect.Modifier. Only used in the case that this GVariable represents a class field.

isLocal

public boolean isLocal
Specify whether this GVariable is local to its context or not. Here are the rules:

Local:
- local variable - parameter

Not local:
- class field - this expression - super expression - class expression

Ignored for a length expression

type

public GType type
The type of this GVariable. For special keywords, static types apply thus:

this: GType.THIS
super: GType.SUPER
class: GType.CLASS
length: GType.LENGTH

name

public String name
The name of the variable; ignored for special keywords.

initializer

public GExpression initializer
The initializer of the variable; ignored for parameters and special keywords.

prefix

public GExpression prefix
The prefix of the variable; applies optionally to the keywords this and super, is required for the keywords class, length, and may not be applied to dynamic variables of any kind.

plainThis

public static GVariable plainThis()
Construct a reference to the keyword this, unqualified

qualifiedThis

public static GVariable qualifiedThis(GExpression prefix)
Construct a qualified reference to the keyword this, using prefix to determine the particular this to be applied.

Parameters:
prefix - prefix to the this expression which determines which particular this will be applied.
